content.description: climb up beautiful clean slab to bulge, follow the black water streak past the crux then up a ramping dihedral
content.location: left of the biggest roof on the right side of the wall.

content.description: climb face (or use the ow if you must add to the challenge)to the 6ft roof. stem left avoiding the roof after protecting w/ tcu's. then up varied cracks, stepping right (exposure) and finnishing in a right facing dihedral.
content.protection: multiple finger sized tcu's, nuts. gear to #3 although I didn't need it I did place a #5 as my first piece because I had it.
content.location: Far left side of the wall, right of the obvious ow/chimney and up to the roof.   walk off to the west.

content.description: climb the slab right of the yawing ow/chimney. holds and gear appear as you approach them. We spent quite a bit of time cleaning lichen but more remains- this route will probably get easier as organic material wears off.
start on a ledge 10ft off the ground (avoids a large bush) climb clean face utilizing small cracks and horizontals for tcu's. pass the bulge at it's weakness then follow dihedral to the top.
climb up steep face to dihedral up to a 10ft roof, exit the left side (exposure!!!) and up to the summit.
content.protection: trad doubles of finger sized then singles to #3camlot
content.location: far Right side of wall, shares anchor to left with Propaganda 5.10.

content.description: West of the Spaghetti Western Wall, east of Finktion Wall.   East facing.
